results.title: The Movies Are Back. But What Are Movies Now?
results.abstract: Cinephiles and streaming fans can both claim victory. But as we better understand the new screen culture taking shape, it looks like we may all lose in the long run.

results.title: James Gunn Nearly Blew Up His Career. Now He’s Back With ‘The Suicide Squad’
results.abstract: The “Guardians of the Galaxy” director talks about the Twitter controversy that got him temporarily fired from Marvel, and his crossover to the DC franchise.

multimedia.caption: Before the Twitter controversy, James Gunn said, “I realized that I had closed myself off to things I thought were schmaltzy because I didn’t want to be vulnerable.”

results.title: After Backlash Over Its Reform Plans, Golden Globes Group Considers a New Option
results.abstract: Proposals for the embattled Hollywood Foreign Press Association include adding 50 members to its voting ranks to bring in more diversity and creating a for-profit spinoff company.

multimedia.caption: The troubled nonprofit behind the Golden Globes has faced an outcry over financial, ethical and diversity lapses, leading NBC to cancel next year’s telecast.
The troubled nonprofit behind the Golden Globes has faced an outcry over financial, ethical and diversity lapses, leading NBC to cancel next year’s telecast.

results.title: Parents Who Never Stopped Searching Reunite With Son Abducted 24 Years Ago
results.abstract: Guo Gangtang’s cross-country, decades-long search for his son inspired a movie. Now, there’s an ending fit for Hollywood.

results.title: Cannes: Anatomy of a Standing Ovation for ‘The French Dispatch’

results.title: Paul Huntley, Hair Master of Broadway and Hollywood, Is Dead at 88
results.abstract: The many famous heads he worked on included those of Elizabeth Taylor and Carol Channing. Some actors requested him in their contracts.

multimedia.caption: Paul Huntley working with Glenn Close for the musical “Sunset Boulevard” at the Minskoff Theater on Broadway in 1995. He created the hair and wigs for more than 200 shows, including “The Elephant Man,” “Chicago” and “Cats.”

results.title: William Smith, Action Star Known for His Onscreen Brawls, Dies at 88
results.abstract: In addition to his Hollywood legacy, the Missouri native was also a bodybuilder, a champion discus thrower and a published poet.

multimedia.caption: The actor William Smith in 1978. Mr. Smith had more than 300 acting credits listed on IMDb from 1954 to 2020. He did many of his own stunts.
